question.text: Identify the correct option regarding the structure given below.

options.text: The given structure is IgM and it is present in the body secretions.
The given structure is IgM which has 10 valency and can bind to 10 different antigens.
The given structure is IgA, produced during severe infection in the body and binds to allergens.
The given structure is IgM produced by B-cells and apparently controls the activity of B-cell.

solution.text: IgM is the pentameric antibody molecule produced by the antibody and apparently controls the activity of B-cell. It activates the phagocytosis and complement-mediated lysis of the infected cell. They have 10 valency and can bind to 7-8 antigens at a time. These are the antibodies that mount the primary immune response.
